intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subadunans, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its root system is fibrous and shallow. Hieracium subadunans is typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
